name: places/ChIJQxjtfBz2wokRhwyV-7gR7Nc

displayName.text: Terence Cardinal Cooke Health Care Center

authorAttributions.displayName: ArchCare at Terence Cardinal Cooke Health Care Center

adrFormatAddress: 1249 5th Ave, New York, NY 10029-4413, USA

originalText.text:
So my first question is what the hell is the executive board doing about this number of negative reviews?  Zip.

We were horrified to read about the rodent problem prior to Columbia Presbyterian sending our aunt here.  In retrospect dealing with mice would have been the most pleasant thing about this place.

The social worker spends the day - literally - hiding in her office with the door closed.  The aides must get paid less then minimum wage because they wear their misery on their sleeves, are rude and just lack the basic skills to succeed in their roles.

We had made several requests for specific care and it felt almost by spite we were denied every time although they repeatedly claimed they would "get on it right away".

I do not believe there is even a close to adequate rehab facility in all of Manhattan but TCC is like NYC's own little Shutter Island, bottom of its class.

originalText.text:
My father was sent here after receiving open heart surgery at Columbia Presbyterian. To be completely transparent, this place is in terrible condition. There are literally mice running around the halls and in patient’s rooms. Virtually everything is filthy to the touch. Being located near Central Park in a rather affluent area does not change that. Some patients were smoking in the lobby before I went upstairs to see my father. Most of the staff (not all) are neglectful of the patients, most are unprofessional, and the establishment is not fitting for any rehabilitation whatsoever, as there is no real rehabilitation being offered to anyone. The patients are often more friendly and approachable than the staff. My father has yet to receive any physical therapy, and when I went to visit him on his first day there, no staff had addressed his soiled gown and sheets. He was in an uncomfortable posture (I have no idea how long he was in that posture considering the dry vomit on his gown) and did not have the bare necessities provided to him at Columbia Presbyterian. The food is atrocious. My father’s condition is seemingly worse than when he first went in, and I am very concerned about that. The water running from the sink in the room was very concerning as well, but not surprising when you consider the overall condition of the place… I will do everything I can to get him removed from this Hell hole. If you want your loved ones to survive, please do not allow them to stay at this place. I highly doubt that they will survive the duration of their stay there. Archcare only receives one star, because there is not an option for 0.

Update: Three weeks later and my father is back in the hospital… What is seemingly nursing home negligence, has led my father back into the step-down unit… I sincerely regret ever letting my father set foot in that place… DO NOT LET ANYONE YOU LOVE STAY AT TERENCE CARDINAL COOKE. They can and will die there…

Update: My father passed away on July 6th 2023... He passed away roughly a week after his stay at Terence Cardinal Cooke… Again, if you care about your loved ones, do everything in your power to keep them out of that Hell hole… That place needs to be shut down…

originalText.text: 0 stars. I don't wish this place on my own worst enemy. Horrible place. From the first day, they wouldn't give me an extra water jug for ice. Only one per room they said with rudeness. And they never ask or check if she needed  water to the point I had to bring water for her from the outside and a littlecoolerfor her ice. I had to do that every day. Even asking for a shower is a situation. Always saying the shower is full or occupied even tho i could see it was empty. One worker came in the room and forcefully took towels away from my loved one saying that they need towels for the rest of patients. When i got there i took clean towels right in front of her and she said nothing to me. There was plenty of towels. I had to show my face every day because of how worried i was. They are under staffed and overcrowded. The staff is lazy and have a DO NOT CARE attitude. Last Saturday i witnessed a patient call for help for an hour while they just listened and didn't have a care in the world.  I mentioned it to a aid and she said they were busy even tho she was doing nothing.  Its rikers for seniors. The nurse RUTH CAVALERO (4rth floor) was unprofessional and incredibly rude. She did not tend to my loved one's wounds and did not medicate her properly. Hardly ever came in the room. And the minute I asked her a question she played it off like she was super busy and gave a ton of attitude. She should be fired immediately and get put to work in a kennel. Trina the social worker was unavailable and hardly came to work. I knocked her door for several days, nothing. Ignored my phone calls and took 7 days to do the proper paper work to let my loved one go home even tho she was cleared for a week. Then lied about the whole thing. Disgusting! They ignore and treat patients like dogs. This place should really be closed down and everyone fired.

originalText.text: This place is horrible the social workers do not do there jobs I've called over 10 ten tines one day trying to get my father a day pass for Christmas. They say come during the week to talk to someone and still nothing. They are under staffed. It smells horrible. Some of the employees have nasty dispositions. I would never recommend the place to anyone I wouldn't my Enemies to be here.

originalText.text: This rehab facility is only concerned about the patient’s money/SS check. I want the people to know please be aware and do not be fooled. It’s a trap to make people think that they care. They are money driven and lack every concern regarding patient care . It’s not about the patient it’s about the money. The doctors do not inform you of the patient care . You have to chase after staff they do not return calls. They also feed the patient's inadequate meals to keep their sugars levels high and blood pressure the meal ticket states the meal that isnt provided .I witnesses a patient who sat in a wheelchair for over 8 hours no activities the patients are bored and depressed. My mother was discharged before she met her goals no one informed the family of the discharge we found out through the aide. It is amazing that this facility has an operating license. They should be shut down . This place is a death trap. I made a report against them to the Dept of Health
